definition[0]: to officially force someone to leave a school or organization
example[0]: Two girls were expelled from school for taking drugs.
example[1]: The main opposition leader was expelled from her party.
example[2]: He was expelled for making racist remarks.
definition[1]: to force a foreigner to leave a country, especially because they have broken the law or for political reasons
example[3]: Foreign priests were expelled from the country.
example[4]: Three diplomats were expelled for spying.
definition[2]: to force air, water, or gas etc out of your body or out of a container
definition[3]: to officially make someone leave a country or an organization
example[5]: In the past, the government found it legally difficult to identify and expel illegal immigrants.
example[6]: The governing body will try to expel the members from the trade union.
